intro: Hibbertia glebosa subsp. oblonga, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, often appearing in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal regions. Hibbertia glebosa subsp. oblonga is a shrub that can grow up to 1 meter in height.
